title: Maintenance Manager 3 (Property Operations)
description:
C+C Apartment Management LLC is recognized as an industry leader in management and real estate operations. Our team manages the day-to-day operations of over 23,000 residential dwelling units across approximately 400 multi-family buildings throughout the New York Tri-state area. The C+C portfolio contains market rate, mixed market rate, affordable and full tax credit/affordable properties.
  
  

Our mission is to provide exceptional property management services that meet the diverse needs of our various constituents, including our residents, the local community, government and financing agencies, and the owners of the properties. C+C offers a full breadth of management services to improve and enhance a property’s revenue, cost control measures, maintenance, financial reporting, and resident relations.
  
  

C+C Apartment Management LLC is recognized as an industry leader in management and real estate operations. Our team manages the day-to-day operations of over 18,000 residential dwelling units across approximately 400 multi-family buildings throughout the New York Tri-state area. The C+C portfolio contains market rate, mixed market rate, affordable and full tax credit/affordable properties.
  
Our mission is to provide exceptional property management services that meet the diverse needs of our various constituents, including our residents, the local community, government and financing agencies, and the owners of the properties. C+C offers a full breadth of management services to improve and enhance a property’s revenue, cost control measures, maintenance, financial reporting, and resident relations.
  
C&C offers competitive compensation and benefits and tremendous potential with a growing residential real estate developer/builder organization. For more information, please visit: https://ccmanagers.com/
  
  

Areas of Responsibility and Job Requirements
  
Oversee the maintenance department ensuring the physical condition of the property is being properly maintained. Service as an extension of Property Management.
  
  

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**  

Responsible for maintaining, tracking and administering all maintenance related tasks working closely with the building Superintendents and property management
  
Responsible for assigning work to contracted vendor and performing quality control until project is completed
  
Ability to delegate tasks and responsibilities to maintenance team and Superintendent in an effective, and efficient manner
  
Request, compare and bid-level vendor proposal estimates
  
Source maintenance supplies and equipment for building related repair projects
  
Look for best prices available
  
Resolve property related emergencies as needed
  
Must display the ability to multi-task extremely well and display the ability to complete tasks and projects on time.
  
Track and manage projects with contractors and maintenance staff and obtain status updates
  
Periodically inspects work performed by other service team members to assess effectiveness of policies and procedures and develop corrective action plans as needed
  
Develops standards for the cleanliness and overall appearance of the property grounds, amenities, building exteriors, make-ready units, leasing office and other buildings and common areas
  
Supports cost-cutting and expense control initiatives by completing internal repairs, when possible, reduce use of contracted services
  
Document daily progress reports and maintain daily maintenance logs
  
Perform weekly supply room inventory audit, ordering supplies when necessary.
  
  

**Minimum Education Requirements:**  

High School Diploma or equivalency
  
Technical training or other trade school or organizations preferred in: Construction, Electrical, Plumbing Carpentry, Apartment renovations, Low-pressure boilers
  
  

**Minimum Years of Experience Required:**  

7+ years of experience as a Maintenance Manager, Superintendent or Project Manager
  
A minimum of 2 years’ experience managing union/non-union maintenance employees
  
  

**Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**  

Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel is required.

This role frequently requires incumbent to talk and hear, expressing or exchanging ideas by means of spoken work and the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, and to make distinctions in sound.
  
  

This role frequently requires incumbent to engage in repetitive movements with the wrist, hands, and fingers by typing, stand for long periods of time, walking and/or moving about on foot to accomplish tasks particularly for long distances; moving from one work site to another or occasionally in narrow aisles, hallways, or passageways; reach, touch objects with fingers, palm, and hands, picking, pinching, typing or otherwise working, primarily with fingers rather than with the whole hand as in handling
  
  

This role occasionally requires incumbent to climb, balance, kneel, crouch, stoop, push, pull, lift objects up to 10 pounds.
  
  

.Work Environment

The incumbent may occasionally be subject to noise sufficient to cause the worker to shout in order to be heard above the noise or vibration.

title: Associate, Patient Access
description:
Pay Rate: $23.28 per hour.  


Responsible for obtaining all demographic and insurance information; to ensure accurate and timely medical record completion in accordance with Joint Commission on Accreditation of Health Organizations (JC) Department of Health (DOH) standards and medical staff bylaws, rules and regulations. This position is responsible for ensuring the effective management of all incoming referrals, authorizations, Pre-Registration and Scheduling and the transition of inquiries to the appropriate service lines. Responsible for completing/distributing paperwork, entering pertinent patient information into Hospital Information System, verifying insurance eligibility, identifying out of pocket cost, and communicating with staff and patients on point of cash requirements on/before service date.  

**Education/Training**: High school diploma or equivalent required. Associate's degree strongly preferred. In the absence of an Associate degree, a combination of either health care finance or healthcare access certification (CHAA) or specific experience can be substituted. Ability to read, write and communicate in English. Bilingual (Spanish) a plus.  


Required to successfully complete the pre-access orientation program and pass competency test within 30 days of hire/transfer.  


**Experience**: Three (3) years of patient registration or patient accounting experience required. Experience must have included frequent customer interaction with a broad and diverse community. Prior experience must demonstrate the ability to work well under pressure, and to prioritize and multi-task with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail. Prior experience working with Windows-based software. Ability to learn new processes, procedures, and software programs quickly.  

**Licensure, Registration or Certification****:** N/A

title: Web Development and Technology Specialist
description:
**Position Overview:** We are seeking a skilled Web Development and Technology Specialist with a strong background in WordPress and SEO to support the digital needs of our organization. This role is responsible for building and maintaining websites, implementing SEO best practices, managing our internal intranet site, and leading various tech projects that support the growth and efficiency of FIT Franchise Brands.

**About Us:** FIT Franchise Brands is the parent company to two leading fitness brands, THE MAX Challenge and Farrell's eXtreme Bodyshaping. We are dedicated to empowering our members to achieve their fitness goals through community support, expert guidance, and personalized programs. As we continue to grow, we're looking for a talented and motivated Web Development and Technology Specialist to join our team.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Website Development & Maintenance:** Build, maintain, and enhance websites for FIT Franchise Brands and its subsidiaries using WordPress. Ensure that all sites are optimized for performance, security, and user experience.
* **SEO Optimization:** Implement and monitor SEO strategies to improve organic search rankings and drive traffic to our websites. Conduct regular SEO audits and make data-driven recommendations for improvements.
* **Intranet Management:** Oversee and manage the internal intranet site, ensuring it is up-to-date, user-friendly, and serves as a central hub for internal communications and resources.
* **Technical Support:** Provide technical support for various digital initiatives, including troubleshooting website issues, managing plugins, and ensuring compatibility across browsers and devices.
* **Project Management:** Lead and manage tech projects that support organizational growth, including integrations, digital enhancements, and system improvements.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with marketing, operations, and other internal teams to align web development efforts with business objectives and ensure consistency in branding and messaging.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in WordPress development, including custom theme and plugin development.
* Strong understanding of SEO best practices, with experience in keyword research, on-page optimization, and SEO audits.
* Experience managing and enhancing internal intranet sites.
* Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP.
* Familiarity with web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, SEMrush).
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience working with fitness or franchise-based organizations.
* Familiarity with Canva
* Knowledge of API integrations and third-party services.
* Basic understanding of digital marketing principles.

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work with a passionate team committed to making a positive impact on people's lives.
* Professional development and growth opportunities within a rapidly expanding organization.
* A collaborative and supportive work environment.

title: Part Time Barista Associate - MUJI Chelsea Market
description:
**About MUJI:**  
MUJI is a global retailer of high-quality, simple products across various categories – from homewares to fashion to wellness and more – that provide satisfying, expertly-designed solutions for everyday needs. MUJI’s full name, Mujirushi Ryohin, loosely translates to “No-Brand, Quality Goods”, underscoring its enduring commitment to modesty, affordability, and quality.

Established in Japan in 1980, MUJI has steadily grown as the go-to brand for millions of loyal customers in 32 countries and regions around the world offering over 7,000 products. While varying significantly in purpose and use, MUJI products are marked by the quality, craftsmanship, knowledge, expertise, and skill that is embodied in being able to get something very simple, very right.

MUJI continually strives to embody business practices that demonstrate a commitment to our communities and environment. We seek for our future MUJI team members to be aligned with this very same brand ethos to create a positive impact in all of our communities, neighborhoods, and networks.

MUJI seeks to add a **Barista Associate,** to the **Chelsea Market** team. This is a multi-faceted role where you will have the opportunity to be involved in a variety of functions. If your experience/education and/or skill set match our needs, we want to hear from you!

**Duties include but not limited to:**

Customer Service and Sales

* Opening and closing the café
* Participate in daily general operations
* Changing food displays
* Receiving /Ordering café supplies
* Organizing/Cleaning café area
* Follow proper food service inventory procedures to ensure accurate recording of inventory data
* Maintain a neat, clean, inviting cafe area for guests all day, every day
* Provide superior customer service
* Help customers make selections by building customer confidence; offering suggestions and opinions
* Develop knowledge of the MUJI product range and sales techniques required to sell them

Store Merchandising/ Product Handling

* Develop high standards of merchandise presentation and stock handling as per MUJI U.S.A. guidelines
* Ensure that shop floor and staff areas housekeeping, and presentation are exemplary

Systems

* Make efficient and effective use of all store equipment and systems, including the POS (point of sale) system
* Assist where directed, with all forms of stock control, including twice-yearly inventories, pricing, sales preparation

Security

* Adhere to company’s security procedures

Health & Safety

* Be aware of and adhere to company’s health and safety guidelines
* Adhere to proper manual handling techniques
* Food Service License

General

* Manage all aspects of the cafe
* Lead and motivate team to maintain café area, as well as drive sales
* Quickly resolve and/or communicate any issues or problems with management to find appropriate resolution
* Take initiative
* Flexibility to work varied hours including late shifts, weekends and holidays

Job Description:

* Good communication
* Excellent customer service
* Initiative
* Team player

Hours preference:  
Part time employees enjoy a flexible work schedule.

Benefits:  
Competitive pay, paid sick days, and employee discount on MUJI products.

Please attach resume when applying.

Pay: $16.50 - $19.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Paid sick time

Shift:

* 8 hour shift

title: Consumer Insights Director
description:
Careers that unlock the magic of human connection
Who we are
Pernod Ricard is a global premium spirits and wine company. We’re the team behind leading brands such as ABSOLUT® Vodka, Jameson® Irish Whiskey, Malibu®, Kahlúa® Liqueur, Beefeater® Gin, and Avión™ Tequila, as well as many more superior wines and exquisite champagnes!
Working at Pernod Ricard is all about igniting conviviality in that all that we do. Derived from the French word, *convivialité*…it means human connection, authenticity, friendly, and jovial. Conviviality is energy and spirit with a splash of *je ne sais quoi* and is a core philosophy around how we live and work at Pernod Ricard. Here, we are team players, dream makers, trailblazers, movers and (cocktail) shakers. We have a passion for living life to the fullest, making a new friend every day, and realizing our potential as people and as a business!*The salary range for this role, based in New York, is $169,224 to $211,530, range will vary if outside of this location. Base salaries are determined during our interview process, by assessing a candidate’s experience, skills against internal peers and against the scope and responsibilities of the position.*
Job Summary:
Join us as the Director of Brand Insights and lead the charge in consumer-driven decision-making and strategic insights for brand marketing. This role offers the opportunity to deliver streamlined insights and high-quality information to top executives, while establishing and implementing marketing frameworks. You’ll be the main contact for HQ Insights COE team and a champion of consumer understanding to enhance communication, innovation, and strategy.
Who will love this job:* A strategic thinker with a passion for consumer insights and market research.
* A persuasive communicator who can influence at all levels, including global stakeholders.
* A data storyteller who can uncover key insights from fragmented data.
* A collaborative leader who thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.


What you’ll do:* Centralize and report brand performance insights to leadership.
* Translate corporate strategies into actionable brand insights.
* Integrate consumer recommendations into strategic planning.
* Support annual planning and develop global-local consumer strategies.
* Own brand learning plans and decision criteria.
* Standardize brand insights procedures with Insights COE.
* Collaborate with Market Companies on prioritization and decision-making.
* Adapt and streamline new planning processes as needed.


What’s in it for me?
Being part of an inclusive and diverse company where professional development and internal career mobility is front-and-center to our talent strategy. This means your career at Pernod Ricard has many possibilities. You'll be part of a culture that celebrates the rich diversity of our people across the globe and be part of our long-standing commitment to making exceptional products, giving back to our communities, and honoring our responsibility to preserve the environment.
Required qualifications:* 7+ years of experience in consumer insights and market research.
* Expertise in communications development and brand planning.
* Strong data storytelling skills, uncovering key insights from fragmented data.
* Persuasive and influential at all levels, including global stakeholders.
* Proficient in using advanced analytics and market performance data.
* Experience across major insights areas: brand, shopper, innovation.


Attributes for success in this role:* Strategic thinker with a passion for consumer insights.
* Persuasive communicator and data storyteller.
* Collaborative leader who thrives in a dynamic environment.


Life and perks at Pernod Ricard
Proud to belong - Just as we help to create moments that matter for our customers, we lead by example every day...bringing our whole self to work and building bonds that celebrate the human spirit, diversity, and foster deep connections.
Empowered to soar - We set high expectations and seek to get the most out of life. Through flexibility and a hybrid workstyle, as well as unique learning opportunities, generous tuition reimbursement, and one-of-a-kind learning programs, we passionately grow our skillset.
Committed to care - We are deeply committed to the long-term sustainability of our people, our industry, and our planet. We call this return on responsibility. From environmental sustainability to supporting local communities, our commitment is steadfast.
Inspired to dream - We treasure new experiences and are proud to develop as people, not job titles. From rich immersive learning programs in Paris to exciting high-profile events, we blend a love of exploration into all that we do.
Our hybrid work style
At Pernod Ricard North America, our work philosophy celebrates the magic of human connection with the flexibility needed to provide one's most meaningful contribution. Our hybrid teams will work remotely the majority of the time and unite on-site two days per week or 40% of the time. Our team is empowered to start and finish their day at a time that works best for their lifestyle with the whole team available during the core hours of 10am-3pm.
Plus, great benefits and perks to toast to a life filled with support including:* Competitive compensation including performance bonuses
* Domestic & international career development opportunities
* Competitive paid time off plan + wellbeing days
* Medical, dental, vision and life insurance
* Product allowance to enjoy on Pernod Ricard products
* Gym reimbursement
* Employee Assistance Program
* BetterUp Care wellness benefits including nutrition, sleep, executive coaching, etc.


And much, much more! Check out PRUSABenefits.com to view our extensive people programs and support.
Job Posting End Date:
Target Hire Date:
2024-09-30
Target End Date:

title: Screen Print Operator
description:
The **Screen-Printing Operator** is responsible for the safe and efficient operation of a press while adhering to customer specification, quality requirements, company standards, guideline and safety standards. This position is responsible for the overall completion of the job assigned to the Press Operator 2nd shift 4:20pm - 2:40am Monday - Thursday. Mandatory over-time on Fridays.

* Inspections of printed material to ensure the correctness in all areas of color, registration, stock, and all other customer specifications.
* Adjusting and maintaining registration, color, perforations, and other customer specific printing specifications.
* Observes the press operations to detect any machine or equipment malfunctions and moves to correct the issues.
* Makes adjustments to all press machine parts and equipment: feeders, grippers, guides, feed wheels, cameras, and other machines parts, using proper equipment.
* Conducts a visual inspection prior to printing of all material stock and ink for defects or noncompliance to job specifications.
* Carries out the final inspection to ensure the material, ink, plates or screens, cylinder/rollers, tension, and all other necessary customer specifications are correct prior to the start of the running the job.
* Review and interpret job specifications and work order instructions, delegates or carries out directions as needed.
* Ensures all job-related data (time and material) are entered into the ERP system (DISO).
* Ensures all unused material goes back to the designated area after each job is finished running.
* Ensure complete and proper line clearance has been conducted. Maintain the daily activity production log and all other required documentation for the press and work orders. Performs the general maintenance of the press or minor repairs.

Education

* High School Diploma or General Equivalent Degree (GED).

Experience:

* Knowledge of cGMP, ISO and Lean Manufacturing is a plus. Reading, analyzing, and interpreting technical procedures, manuals and manufacturing documents including the system of Graphic specification/Graphic identical/Articles.
* Experience with inks and material.
* Experience with handling and proper caring of die cutting tools.
* Experience with machine set-up
* Experience with UV and water-based inks preferred.
* Experience working with vision systems preferred.
* Working knowledge of quality procedures in the pharmaceutical industry preferred.
* Intermediate level of computer knowledge in the Microsoft Office Suites.

Physical Requirements

* Ability to lift 50 pounds.
* Standing for long periods of time.
* Work activity requires repetitive bending, reaching, walking, stooping, and crouching, lifting, and climbing.

**Come join our growing team! Schreiner Group offers excellent benefits, engaging work environment & career growth opportunities! We also recognize the hardships inflation has caused and have given our staff compensation to assist with inflation costs.**

title: Ink Technician
description:
**Plate making & Ink Technician: Job Description**

**Schreiner Group LP** has a full-time regular position for a **Plate making & Ink Technician**. The Plate making & Ink Technician will be an active and integral part of the Production team.

Our facility operates on a 10-hour day schedule with Fridays for potential overtime. The ability to work overtime is required for this position. **Currently looking for someone to join our 2nd shift team.** 

***Responsibilities***

* Preparing and inspecting printing plates and printing screens for production (Flexo plates, flat screens and Rotary screens)
* Usage of computerized system to load output files into Computer-to-Plate and Computer-to-Screen equipment
* Retrieving plates, screens and die cutting tools from Archive Storage
* Mixing/toning of spot colors and varnishes; mixing of inks for color match
* Maintains ink recipes in the ERP system as well as preparing color proofs
* Inventory control of Inks/varnishes in storage through ERP system
* Assembly of job components (Plates, die cutting tools, inks, documentation) to prepare job for press
* Perform and assist in the preventive maintenance needed for all plate making equipment (Plate Exposure systems, Washout system, etc.)
* Control waste by controlling ongoing quality checks during production of films and plates
* Aid in all trouble shooting for the press which relate to printing plates/ screens, inks or color mismatch

***Qualifications***

* High School Diploma or General Equivalent Degree or higher educational degree
* 1-5 years' experience within the field of print production
* Reading, analyzing, and interpreting technical procedures, manuals and manufacturing documents
* Basic knowledge of Adobe Illustrator
* Intermediate level of compute knowledge in the Microsoft Office Suites
* Ability to lift 50 pounds
* Standing or sitting for long periods time

title: Part Time Nanny needed in Briarcliff, NY
description:
Start: ASAP

Age(s) of Child(ren): 2 children – 1 to 8-year-old

Schedule: Monday - Friday 8am - 12pm

Description:

**Part Time Nanny needed in Briarcliff**

A loving family of 4 is looking for a part time nanny for their children ages 1 to 8 years old! This is a great role for someone with strong knowledge of age-appropriate activities, someone who puts the safety of the children above all and truly loves working with children. Responsibilities will include meal preparation, engaging the child with age-appropriate activities, pick-ups and drop offs, helping with homework, playdates. and help with light cleaning and routing household chores. The position starts ASAP. They are looking for someone who is warm, efficient, and can work with them as a team and become a part of their family.

**Ideal Nanny**

The ideal nanny candidate would embody a blend of professionalism, warmth, and reliability. They would have a sincere passion for childcare, consistently demonstrating patience, creativity, and enthusiasm in their interactions with children. With a minimum of 5 years of professional experience, they would be well-versed in developmental milestones, capable of planning and facilitating activities that promote learning and growth.

Possessing a valid First Aid/CPR certification, the candidate would prioritize safety and be prepared to handle emergencies efficiently. Their references would reflect a history of dependable, compassionate care, and their background check would be clear of any discrepancies. They would be a non-smoker with reliable transportation and a clean driving record, indicative of their dependability. Flexibility is crucial, and the ideal candidate would adapt seamlessly to our changing schedules, showing availability for occasional weekends and a long-term commitment to our family.

**Position Requirements**

● Experience: Minimum of 5 years of professional childcare experience.

● Certification: Valid First Aid/CPR certification for infants and children.

● References: Excellent references from previous employers.

● Background Check: Clear background check.

● Communication: Strong communication skills in English.

● Driver’s License: Valid driver's license and clean driving record (for driving positions).

● Age Group Experience: Experience with infants, toddlers and pre-school.

● Activity Planning: Ability to plan and engage in developmentally appropriate activities.

● Housekeeping: Willingness to perform light housekeeping related to the children.

● Non-Smoker: Must be a non-smoker.

● Transportation: Reliable transportation.

● Flexibility: Flexibility with hours and availability for occasional weekends.

● Commitment: Ability to commit long term.

**Compensation/Benefits**

● Competitive Pay: $30-$35 per hour

● Benefits: PTO, Sick Days, Federal Holidays +

If you meet the qualifications and are excited about this opportunity, please log in and review your candidate profile. Make sure your profile is complete and up to date with your current position.

---

*Modern Maison is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds to apply.*

title: Preschool Teacher Assistant
description:
Tiegerman at Woodside is a special needs program servicing children from preschool through high school. We are looking for dedicated teacher assistants to join our Woodside program for current and upcoming school years. Tiegerman is a 12 month program

Hours: **8:00AM-3:00PM**

Requirements: High School Diploma or Equivalent; Must be willing to pursue or actively working towards a NYS Teaching Assistant Certification and Registered Behavior Technician Certificate (RBT).

Responsibilities include:

Discuss assigned duties with classroom teachers to plan daily goals.

Prepare lesson materials and displays for all of the students.

Present subject matter to students under the direction and guidance of teachers, using lectures, discussions, or supervised role-playing methods.

Assist all of the children individually or in small groups in order to help them in achieving all of their goals for the completion of assignments and to reinforce learning concepts presented by teachers.

Watch over the students and accompany them to classrooms, halls, cafeterias, school yards, bathrooms, and gymnasiums.

Distribute classroom materials to all students.

Enforce administration policies and rules pertaining to classroom etiquette, proper dress attire for students, and Tiegerman policies and procedures.

Assist the teacher with grading homework and tests as needed.

Supervise students in the use and care of equipment and materials, in order to ensure the safety of the students.

Observe and document student progress.

Arrange and supervise games and other recreational activities to promote physical, mental, and social development while allowing the students to enjoy their recreational activities.

Participate in teacher-parent conferences on an annual basis to inform and educate parents of the progress of their children.

Take class attendance several times a day to ensure that all students are in the appropriate area and supervised at all times.

Assist in pick up and drop off of students at busing every day.

Assist librarians in school libraries.

Attend all staff meetings within and outside of regular working hours

Provide students with assistive devices.

Set a good example in terms of dress, punctuality, and attendance.

Minimum Required Education: High School Diploma or Equivalent

title: Warehouse Associate/Driver
description:
**Who We Are**  
We’re Dealer Tire, a family-owned, international distributor of tires and parts established in 1918 in Cleveland, OH. We’re laser focused on helping the world’s largest and most trusted auto manufacturers grow their tire business—in fact, we’ve sold more than 60 million tires to date. We’re a thriving company, and we’re looking for driven individuals to join our team. That’s where you come in!

**What’s In It For You**

We have a dedicated crew of more than 1,500 passionate and innovative associates throughout the United States. Here are a few reasons why we’d make a great team:

* **Market leading base pay.** We offer $22.00 per hour to start.
* **Level up your pay.** Opportunity to increase your base pay as soon as you’ve completed your first 45 days of employment.
* **Share the gain and play to win.** Monthly incentive bonus based upon individual contribution and warehouse team performance.
* **We respect your need for work-life balance**. Our Warehouse Associates/Drivers work primarily first shift Monday-Friday, schedules can vary based on business needs.
* **Benefits and perks.** Medical, Dental, Vision insurance plus a 50% 401k match up to a 7% contribution. PTO eligible after 90 days. Additional perks of wellness programs, annual tuition reimbursement between $2,500-$5,000, and discounts on up to 40 tires purchased per year! Earn up to $1,500 per eligible employee referral.
* **Target zero.** Safety is a continuous journey, and we are always striving to improve. We offer extensive training to keep our warehouses, and most importantly, our people injury free and safe!

**Responsibilities**

* Adhere to all safety policies and procedures.
* Provide “world class” customer service.
* Maintain inventory control.
* Ensure shipping accuracy.
* Transport and deliver all orders on time.

**Requirements**

* 21 years or older
* Valid driver’s license
* Ability to pass driver’s road skill test and DOT physical.
* Good communication skills in English (bilingual a plus)
* Lifting up to 70 lbs. frequently, lifting up to 90 lbs. occasionally
* Continuous standing, lifting, bending and pivoting
* Comfortable at heights up to 25’ while using our top-of-the-line material handling equipment.

Drug Policy  
Dealer Tire is a drug-free environment. All applicants being considered for employment must pass a pre-employment drug screening before beginning work. Random drug testing for all Dealer Tire Store associates also is required.

Why Dealer Tire: An amazing opportunity to join a growing organization, built on the efforts of hard working, innovative, and team-oriented people. We offer a competitive salary + bonus, and a comprehensive benefit package including: paid time off, medical, dental, vision, and 401k matching (50% on the dollar up to 7% of employee contribution).

EOE Statement: Dealer Tire is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, veteran status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status or disability (in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act\\*), or any other legally protected status, with respect to employment opportunities.

* ADA Disclosure: Any candidate who feels that they may need an accommodation to complete this application, or any portions of same, based on the impact of a disability should contact Dealer Tire’s Human Resources Department to discuss your specific needs. Please feel free to contact us at 833-483-8232.

title: Patient Experience Coordinator
description:
**The Opportunity**

A Patient Experience Coordinator (PXC) will execute all patient-facing tasks and inquiries while providing exceptional customer service. The PXC will represent and be the “face” of Mindful Care. This role is responsible for handling patient scheduling/rescheduling, payment collections, and inquiries related to Mindful Care services via phone calls, texting, and email for all locations. You will also be responsible for triaging incoming inquiries from other departments and re-engaging patients who no-show for their appointments.

You will manage all in-office appointments and be physically present for the person’s needs. Our ideal candidate will have a passion for helping others and be able to support and advocate for the best possible experience.

**Responsibilities**

* Interact with prospective people to connect them to Mindful Care
* Support people through the intake process and establishing their Patient Portal and provide people with basic tech support to facilitate their provider experience
* Answer all incoming calls for all locations and return any voicemails that are left outside of business hours
* Provide Check-in and Check-out for everyone
* Handle all scheduling / rescheduling requests via phone/email/text
* Provide same-day eligibility and verification
* Help collect balance due, copayments, and no-show fees
* Tackle all provider requests for contact with patients
* Act as office manager and provide office maintenance, point of contact for new office staffing, and escort in office visits to the examination room
* Triage all incoming inquiries for other departments
* Other tasks as assigned by management

**Candidate Profile**

* 2+ years of experience in a medical office/hospital/clinic environment is required; previous experience in mental health care is preferred
* High school diploma or equivalent required
* Experience verifying health insurance
* Office management experience is required
* Prior customer service experience (medical or mental health practices preferred)
* Ability to provide excellent customer service over the phone, email, text
* Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* Must be well organized, attentive to details and can work in a fast-paced work environment
* Must have strong computer proficiency
* Demonstrates awareness, inclusivity, sensitivity, humility, and experience in working with individuals from diverse ethnic backgrounds, socioeconomic statuses, sexual orientations, gender identities, and other various aspects of culture
* Bilingual (English/Spanish)

**Position Type & Schedule**

* Type: Regular Full-time
* Hours: Monday – Friday 8am-5pm ET, will move to a 4/10 schedule in the future.
* Location: 100% in office

**Additional Benefits:**

* Medical, Vision, Dental Health Benefits
* Commuter Benefits
* Health Savings Account
* Dependent Care Savings Account
* Flexible Spending Account
* 401(k) with matching
* PTO
* Sick Pay
* Paid Holidays

**Salary/Wage:**

$20/hr.

**The Company**

Person by person, we believe we can reimagine mental healthcare for everyone, at any point in their lives. We are a human potential brand—obsessively focused on guiding the individual toward comprehensive mental healthcare, and being an ally to everyone no matter where they are. We compete on frictionless urgent access to affordable mental healthcare including depression and anxiety, and well beyond that, too. From acute crisis to long standing challenges, we help people heal by connecting them with care so they can lead more fulfilling lives.

We believe the pursuit of better mental healthcare is never finished, never stops, and is always just beginning.

title: Seasonal Housekeeping & Operations (Janitorial)

description:

Proven experience as forklift operator

Excellent physical condition and coordination

title: Marketing Associate
description:
**Join Our Marketing Team at Oakland Spine & Physical Therapy!**

Are you passionate about marketing and looking for a role where your creativity and enthusiasm can truly shine? Oakland Spine & Physical Therapy is on the hunt for a vibrant individual to become a key player in our marketing team. If you’re eager to bring your fresh ideas to the table and help us connect with our community, we’d love to meet you!

**What You'll Be Doing:**

* **Dream Big:** Brainstorm and develop creative marketing campaigns that captivate and engage our audience.
* **Get Hands-On:** Dive into various marketing activities, from crafting compelling content to planning exciting events.
* **Partner Up:** Work with external vendors to bring promotional events and campaigns to life.
* **Create & Innovate:** Design marketing materials using Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, Mailchimp, and other tools.
* **Collaborate:** Team up with marketing and other professionals to enhance our brand and marketing efforts.
* **Reach Out:** Execute initiatives through social media, email, and mailers to connect with our audience.
* **Analyze & Improve:** Review marketing data to refine our strategies and ensure we’re on the right track.
* **Own It:** Tackle individual marketing tasks and contribute to our team’s success.

**What We’re Looking For:**

* **Tool Mastery:** Proficiency with Canva, Mailchimp, and Adobe is essential.
* **Eager Learner:** Experience with marketing data analytics is a plus, but a strong desire to learn is key.
* **Tech-Savvy:** Solid computer skills, including MS Office and design programs.
* **Detail-Oriented:** Highly organized and responsive, with a knack for staying on top of tasks.
* **Communicator:** Exceptional writing and communication skills that make your ideas come to life.
* **Creative Spirit:** A blend of commercial awareness and creative thinking.
* **Educational Background:** A degree in marketing, communications, or a related field is preferred, but we’re happy to train the right person.

**What We Offer:**

* **Compensation:** Competitive salary, discussed during the interview, based on your experience.
* **Job Type:** Full-time, on site

At Oakland Spine & Physical Therapy, we’re more than just a workplace; we’re a community that values creativity, collaboration, and growth. If you’re excited to contribute to a team that makes a difference in people’s lives, apply today and help us shape the future of our marketing efforts!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

* Monday to Friday

title: Lead Bread Baker
description:
**Full Job Description:** La Farine Pâtisserie et Café, soon to grace the Upper West Side, is on the lookout for passionate and skilled artisans to join our team. Our bakery blends time-honored bread-making traditions with a touch of modern flair, creating a community hub where quality and culture intersect. We seek a **Lead Bread Baker** who is self-reliant, trustworthy, and committed to making La Farine a beloved culinary landmark in NYC.

As the Lead Bread Baker, you will be at the heart of our operations, responsible for crafting a wide range of breads with precision, consistency, and artistry. Your expertise in dough handling, fermentation, and proofing will ensure that every loaf meets our high standards of quality and taste. You will also play a pivotal role in fostering a welcoming and vibrant atmosphere within our bakery, contributing to our mission of excellence and community engagement.

**Responsibilities & Expectations:**

* Lead and execute all stages of bread production, including measuring, mixing, rolling, proofing, and baking.
* Ensure that all baked goods are consistently of the highest quality, addressing any issues promptly with management.
* Monitor inventory levels and adjust production according to daily requirements, ensuring smooth and efficient operations.
* Maintain a clean and organized baking area, adhering to all health and safety standards.
* Demonstrate professionalism and respect in all interactions with team members, suppliers, and customers.
* Train and mentor junior bakers, fostering a collaborative and supportive work environment.
* Uphold the bakery’s ethos of quality, community, and continuous improvement.

**Skills & Requirements:**

* Food Protection Certified.
* Proven experience in bread making, with a strong understanding of various doughs, fermentation, and proofing techniques.
* Culinary arts or specialized bread-making education is highly advantageous.
* Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced and physically demanding environment.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to lead a team.
* Capable of working independently and making informed decisions.
* Must be able to work early mornings, holidays, and weekends as required.
* Physical stamina for standing throughout the shift and lifting up to 50+ lbs.

**Shifts Needed:**

* Early mornings to early afternoons, five days a week, including weekends.

**Compensation & Benefits:**

* $24 - $27/hour (based on experience)
* Paid time off (full-time position only)

*Please note that the salary range is based on meeting the job description qualifications. Applicants who do not fully meet these criteria are still encouraged to apply, but their salary offer may differ from the stated range.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $24.00 - $27.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 40 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Holidays
* Morning shift
* Weekends as needed

Language:

* English (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10024: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
We are looking for a US-based **Customer Success Manager** to join our talented, dynamic, and rapidly growing global team. We have an in-office requirement of 2 days per week for local employees.

**Company Description**

OpenAsset is the only Digital Asset Management solution built for the Architecture, Construction and Engineering industries. We have over 900 clients and 20 years of experience delivering value. Our vision is to inspire people through visualization of the built world.

We are a diverse group of hard-working and entrepreneurial people dedicated to solving complex challenges, working hard on meaningful projects, and celebrating our successes. We are looking for extraordinary people to join our industry-leading and incredibly talented team! Our inspirational and fun working environment, innovation-driven, fast-growing company, and ambitious projects are just a few reasons why you will love working here.

As a company we are passionate about ensuring that diversity and inclusion are championed, and that everybody has a seat at the table. We promote a culture where everyone feels valued, and we have adopted policies to ensure we hire from a diverse pool of candidates.

OpenAsset employs 80 people and is growing rapidly. OpenAsset has partnered with Marlin Equity Partners, an $8bn private equity fund, to help the business scale its sales, technical and management capacity to meet accelerating demand for its B2B SaaS product.

**Customer Success Manager Role Description**

OpenAsset is growing its Customer Success Team and we are looking for an experienced Customer Success Manager to join us! You’ll work closely with our growing number of awesome clients to ensure adoption of OpenAsset and become their trusted advisor and product expert. The ideal candidate would have B2B SaaS experience working with medium to large customers to drive product adoption, communicate best practices, build relationships with key stakeholders, and communicate clear ROI to the customer. If you’re dedicated and ambitious, OpenAsset is an excellent place to continue growing your career.

**Customer Success Manager Responsibilities**

* Manage a portfolio of the world’s leading Architecture, Engineering and Construction (AEC) clients
* Become an OpenAsset product expert and use this knowledge to establish clear business objectives and milestones for clients to work toward
* Drive adoption of OpenAsset through training, communication of best practices, and change management
* Own and ensure retention of recurring client revenue and partner closely with the Account Management team to identify and drive new revenue growth
* Identify, track, and improve the health status of each of your customers
* Collaborate internally across departments (Marketing, Product, Engineering, Renewals/Expansions) to advocate for clients

**Customer Success Manager Skills and Experience**

* 4+ years in a client-facing role managing multiple complex accounts
* 2+ years as a CSM in B2B SaaS with a technical product
* Proactive mindset with excellent organizational and time management skills
* Ability to think critically and problem solve in fast changing environments
* Experience building relationships and communicating with C level and executive stakeholders through Executive or Quarterly Business Review Meetings
* Willing and able to travel when required and lead on-site client meetings

**Technologies we use** 

* Catalyst
* Salesforce
* Gong
* Zendesk
* Slack
* G-Suite

**Benefits**

* Competitive salary
* Medical / Dental / Vision coverage
* 20 days paid time off per year + federal holidays (UK style!)
* 5 paid sick days
* Work from home flexibility
* Commuter benefits
* 401k
* Paid parental leave
* "Getting Started" Stipend
* Career growth and development opportunities

*This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.*

*Axomic is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We base our employment decisions entirely on business needs, job requirements, and qualifications—we do not discriminate based on race, gender, religion, health, parental status, personal beliefs, veteran status, age, or any other status. We have zero tolerance for any kind of discrimination, and we are looking for candidates who share those values. Applications from women and members of underrepresented minority groups are welcomed.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Vision insurance
* Work from home

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10018

title: Orthodontist
description:
\\*Overview\\* We are seeking a skilled and dedicated Orthodontist to join our dental practice. The ideal candidate will have a passion for providing exceptional orthodontic care to patients of all ages, with a focus on improving their dental health and aesthetics. As an Orthodontist, you will be responsible for diagnosing and treating dental and facial irregularities, utilizing advanced techniques and technologies to create personalized treatment plans. \\*Duties\\* - Conduct comprehensive examinations of patients' teeth and jaws to diagnose orthodontic issues. - Develop individualized treatment plans based on patient assessments and needs. - Utilize medical imaging techniques to analyze dental structures and plan treatments. - Apply braces, retainers, and other orthodontic appliances to align teeth properly. - Monitor patient progress throughout treatment, making adjustments as necessary. - Maintain accurate medical documentation in compliance with clinic protocols. - Educate patients and their families on oral hygiene practices and the importance of orthodontic care. - Collaborate with other dental professionals, including general dentists and pediatric specialists, to provide comprehensive care. - Ensure adherence to infection control protocols within the clinic. \\*Requirements\\* - Doctor of Dental Surgery (DDS) or Doctor of Medicine in Dentistry (DMD) degree from an accredited institution. - Completion of an accredited orthodontic residency program. - Valid state dental license with orthodontic specialty certification. - Proficiency in medical coding related to orthodontics is preferred. - Experience with dental software such as Dentrix is a plus. - Familiarity with CAD technology for treatment planning is advantageous. - Strong understanding of infection control procedures in a clinical setting. - Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex procedures in an understandable manner. - Ability to work effectively with children and adolescents in a pediatric setting is desirable. - Knowledge of vital signs monitoring as part of patient assessments is beneficial. Join our team and contribute to creating beautiful smiles while advancing your career in a supportive environment!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $1,210.00 - $1,465.14 per day

Expected hours: 20 – 40 per week

Work Location: In person

title: Artisan Bread Baker
description:
**Baker Position at La Farine Pâtisserie et Café**

**Full Job Description:** La Farine Pâtisserie et Café, soon to grace the Upper West Side, seeks dedicated individuals with a zest for the art of baking and a heart for community. Merging age-old baking crafts with a dash of innovation, we aim not just to serve pastries but to weave a rich tapestry of culture and camaraderie. We're looking for team members who are self-reliant, trustworthy, and have a flair for making everyone's visit memorable. Dive into our mission to become a beloved NYC culinary landmark.

For the Baker role at La Farine Pâtisserie et Café, we are in search of skilled individuals who have a passion for baking and the ability to produce a wide range of breads and pastries with precision and artistry. This position requires someone who can contribute to the welcoming and vibrant atmosphere of our Upper West Side bakery, ensuring that every baked good reflects our commitment to quality and community.

**Responsibilities & Expectations:**

* Embrace and demonstrate professionalism and respect in all dealings with team members and suppliers.
* Participate in every stage of the baking process, including measuring, mixing, rolling, proofing, and baking.
* Monitor inventory levels and quality, adjusting to daily requirements to ensure smooth operations.
* Keep the baking and public areas clean and compliant with health standards.
* Execute tasks as directed by leadership, aiming to surpass standard expectations.
* Commit to the consistent production of high-quality baked goods, voicing any concerns to management.
* Cultivate a supportive and positive workplace aligned with our bakery's ethos.

**Skills & Requirements:**

* Food Protection Certified
* Experience in bread making, including working with various doughs and proofing.
* Culinary arts or pastry/bread making education is advantageous but not mandatory.
* Ability to maintain efficiency in a fast-paced and physically demanding setting.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal skills, and multitasking ability.
* Capable of working well within a team or independently.
* Must be able to work early mornings, holidays, and weekends.
* Physical stamina for standing throughout the shift and lifting up to 50+ lbs.
* Minimum age requirement of 18 years.

**Shifts Needed:**

* Early mornings to early afternoons five days a week, weekends included religiously.
* Options for full-time and part-time positions.

**Compensation & Benefits:**

* $18-21/hour (based on experience)
* Paid time off (full-time position only)
* The salary range is based on meeting the job description qualifications. Applicants not fully meeting these criteria are still encouraged to apply but should note that their salary offer may differ from the stated range.

title: Scratch Instructor (Part Time)
description:
**Job Title:** Scratch Instructor (Part Time)
  
  

**General Responsibilities:** Under the supervision of the Director of Educational Development, plans and facilitates collaborative coding instructional sessions using a variety of block coding languages, robotics, tools, and applications.
  
  

**Major Duties:**  

* Meets regularly with the Director of Educational Development
* Plans and facilitates learning sessions
* Assists students in the development of computer science and coding skills
* Maintains consistent communication the Director of Educational Development
* Models appropriate academic and social behaviors
* Performs other duties as assigned


**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**  

* Ability to work with students of diverse ethnic backgrounds, academic profiles, and skill levels.
* Possess good interpersonal and organizational skills.
* Must demonstrate responsibility, a desire to help others, discretion, and flexibility.
* Knowledge and ability to instruct students in block coding languages such as Scratch and/or Blockly.
* Ability to instruct students on how to control a robot (Ozobot, Sphero, drones, etc) using block coding languages.
* Ability to collect and analyze data to drive future instruction.
* Ability to work independently applying critical thinking skills and problem solving to various situations.
* Must be able to instruct students of varying skill and experience levels in multiple programs based on interest and ability.


**Qualifications:** Must possess a bachelor's degree, teaching and/or tutoring experience, and have or be willing to become fluent with Scratch or other block coding languages

title: Head of Engineering, Growth & Ecosystem (relocate to Singapore)
description:
**About Airwallex**
-------------------


Airwallex is the only unified payments and financial platform for global businesses. Powered by our unique combination of proprietary infrastructure and software, we empower over 100,000 businesses worldwide – including Brex, Rippling, Navan, Qantas, SHEIN and many more – with fully integrated solutions to manage everything from business accounts, payments, spend management and treasury, to embedded finance at a global scale.


Proudly founded in Melbourne, we have a team of over 1,500 of the brightest and most innovative people in tech located across more than 20 offices across the globe. Valued at US$5.6 billion and backed by world-leading investors including Sequoia, Lone Pine, Greenoaks, DST Global, Salesforce Ventures and Mastercard, Airwallex is leading the charge in building the global payments and financial platform of the future. If you're ready to do the most ambitious work of your career, join us.

**About the team:**
===================


The Engineering team at Airwallex is a diverse group of innovators, builders, and problem solvers driven by a mission to empower businesses to operate anywhere, anytime. We thrive in a collaborative and fast-paced environment where we constantly push the boundaries of what's possible in financial technology. As a team, we value technical craftsmanship, continuous learning, and a strong sense of ownership, working together to build scalable, reliable, and secure products that empower businesses of all sizes to grow without borders.

**Job Overview:**
-----------------


As the **Head of Engineering, Growth & Ecosystem**, you will drive the technical strategy and execution for user acquisition, activation, retention, and revenue growth. You will lead a team of talented engineers, working closely with product, data, marketing, and design teams to identify and execute growth opportunities across the customer lifecycle. Your primary goal will be to build scalable growth platforms, develop data-driven experimentation processes, and optimize our product features to enhance user engagement and maximize business growth.


This role is based in **Singapore**.

**Key Responsibilities:**
-------------------------

* **Strategic Leadership:** Develop and implement a comprehensive growth engineering strategy that aligns with the company’s business goals.
* **Team Management:** Lead, mentor, and grow a team of engineers focused on growth initiatives, including hiring and developing top talent.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Partner with product, marketing, data science, and design teams to prioritize and execute growth experiments and initiatives.
* **Data-Driven Optimization:** Utilize data analysis, A/B testing, and experimentation to identify growth opportunities, optimize conversion rates, and enhance the overall user experience.


	+ Increase user sign-ups or registrations
	+ Enhance user engagement and retention
	+ Optimize the user experience to reduce churn
	+ Drive revenue through better conversion rates
* **Platform Development:** Oversee the development and maintenance of scalable systems, tools, and frameworks to support growth initiatives, including marketing automation, personalization, and customer segmentation.
* **Performance Monitoring:** Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) for growth, track progress against these metrics, and report on performance to senior leadership.
* **Market Insights:** Stay up-to-date with industry trends, competitor activities, and emerging technologies to ensure the company’s growth strategy remains innovative and competitive.

**Qualifications:**
-------------------

* **Experience:** 10+ years of experience in software engineering, with at least 3-5 years in a growth-focused role, preferably in a leadership position.
* **Leadership:** Proven track record of leading and growing high-performing engineering teams.
* **Technical Skills:** Strong proficiency in modern programming languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript, Go), data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, R, Python), and experience with growth-related technologies (e.g., analytics platforms, marketing automation).
* **Growth Expertise:** Deep understanding of growth tactics, A/B testing, experimentation frameworks, and data-driven decision-making processes.
* **Analytical Mindset:** Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, focusing on quantitative analysis and the ability to leverage data to drive decisions.
* **Collaboration:** Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; a Master’s degree is a plus.

**Preferred Qualifications:**
-----------------------------

* Experience in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment.
* Knowledge of machine learning, AI, or advanced analytics techniques.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and microservices architecture.

**Equal opportunity**
---------------------


Airwallex is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and anyone seeking employment at Airwallex is considered based on merit, qualifications, competence and talent. We don’t regard color, religion, race, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry, citizenship, sex, marital or family status, disability, gender, or any other legally protected status when making our hiring decisions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

*Airwallex does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms/recruiters. Airwallex will not pay any fees to search firms/recruiters if a candidate is submitted by a search firm/recruiter unless an agreement has been entered into with respect to specific open position(s). Search firms/recruiters submitting resumes to Airwallex on an unsolicited basis shall be deemed to accept this condition, regardless of any other provision to the contrary.*


Compensation Range: $300K - $325K

title: Staffing/ Case Coordinator
description:
**Job description**

**ABOUT OUR COMPANY**

At **A Plus Early Intervention** we recognize that the early years are critical to the success of any child, but are especially vital for a child who has a developmental delay or disability. We are committed to providing individualized and developmentally appropriate education and therapeutic services that are based upon a child’s strengths and needs.

We promote a family centered and holistic approach in which the families’ perspectives, values, and culture are respected and one in which the parents and caregivers play an integral part in their child’s overall education.

**JOB OVERVIEW**

**A Plus Early Intervention** is an actively growing EI provider agency that serves children from birth to age 3. We provide service coordination and therapeutic services in all five boroughs of NYC, Long Island, and Westchester. We are currently looking to grow our agency with quality and dedicated individuals. **A PLUS EI** is seeking a full time **Staffing/ Case Coordinator** who will be responsible for staffing and conducting quality assurance of cases.

Come join the **A+ team**!

**JOB TITLE**

EI Staffing Coordinator/ EI Case Coordinator

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES**

Assist with staffing:

* Assign providers to cases based on availability and location.
* Blast out emails to providers regarding available cases and/or to SCs regarding provider availability for cases.
* Monitor current therapist availability to take cases.

title: Dog Walker
description:
**Join Our Thumping Tails Team - Your Dream Dog Walking Opportunity Awaits!**

At Thumping Tails, we are searching for a dedicated, compassionate, and a patient dog walker who shares our passion for animals. This position offers the potential for opportunities, allowing you to grow with us as we expand our services. Get ready to embark on an exciting journey where your love for dogs and the outdoors comes together in perfect harmony!

**Why Work with Us?**

* Competitive Pay: $19 to $20 an hour
* Exercise and Freedom: Enjoy the outdoors, get your daily exercise, and experience the joy of bonding with furry companions.
* Empowering Environment: As an owner/operator, Michael Ferraro adopts a hands-off approach, allowing you to feel like your own boss.
* Cutting-Edge Technology: Stay connected with our user-friendly app that handles all your appointments and provides GPS tracking for our clients.

**What We Expect from You:**

* Part Time
* Part time hours: as needed between 8am to 3pm
* Camera Phone and Tech Savvy: Be comfortable using technology as all appointments are managed through our app.
* Organizational Skills: Punctuality is essential, as your reliability ensures timely and efficient service.
* Trust and Security: We prioritize safety and will conduct an extensive background check for peace of mind when entering clients' homes.
* Pet Experience: Your passion for animals and pet handling experience are a must to create meaningful connections with our furry friends.

**The Thumping Tails Atmosphere:**

At Thumping Tails, we're a close-knit, caring, and respectful team. We value your dedication and aim to make this role a fulfilling career for you. Your trust and patience in us empower our mission to make every tail wag with joy and contentment.

**Minimum Requirements for Your Application:**

**Own Transportation:** A reliable car is essential for seamless travel between walks.

**Must live within 7 miles away from this zip code: 10543**

Weekend Availability: We need your exceptional care on weekends too, as our furry friends deserve the best seven days a week.

Genuine Love for Animals: Our passion for animals is what drives us, and we hope to share this bond with you.

Effective Communication: Be a good communicator to ensure smooth interactions with clients and the team.

Organized and Reliable: Your dedication to punctuality and reliability ensures a smooth-running schedule.

Physical Stamina: Prepare to walk 5 to 15 miles each day, staying active and energized.

If you're ready to join a team that loves animals as much as you do and are excited about making tails thump with happiness, apply now to be part of our thriving family at Thumping Tails. Check out our website by searching "Thumping Tails LLC" in Harrison, NY, and take the first step towards a rewarding and fulfilling dog walking experience!

Key Words: dog walker, pet sitter, dog, dog walking, dog sitter, pets, dog day care, animal, animal care

title: MSP Service Manager
description:
**About Us:**

InnerCircle Technology Advisors is a high growth Managed Service Provider. We provide high-touch IT support and technology consulting services to meet the unique needs of the alternative investment industry and other demanding professional firms.

We’re driven to help our customers and their employees achieve business goals via customized technology solutions. Although we specialize in technology solutions, we are a people-first company that invests in the long-term success of our employees. Our team affords plenty of opportunity for out-of-the-box thinkers looking to grow their career.

**Note:**

Candidates **MUST** submit a resume in **PDF** format when applying.  
Resumes submitted in other form will not be considered.

**Job Description:**

We are seeking a full time employee as a Service Delivery Manager, who will work to lead our First Response Group.

In your role, you will be charged with providing technical and managerial leadership to our First Response Group. You will act as the primary manager of the group to ensure the proper handling of service delivery and management of day-to-day client issues. Apart from your technical role, you will work with management to mature and develop the leadership structure and systems of the organization.

The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, thorough, have strong collaboration, communication and documentation skills. You should have experience with and be comfortable working as part of a technical team and possess a desire to work with management to help mature our processes and grow our firm.

**Responsibilities:**

· Help lead and prioritize the support team’s workload

· Act as resource to the rest of the team for rapid decisions and direction. Help to coordinate escalations.

· Help identify areas where Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) don't exist or need further work, and help improve those processes

· Regularly monitor team performance and report on metrics. Participate in efforts to drive the improvement of First Response Group performance with respect to service levels and support activities (e.g. manage dashboards, SLA’s, KPI’s. risks/issues)

· Act as a liaison to clients around service delivery issues

· Regularly review opportunities for team training and provide team members with coaching. Listen to team members’ feedback and resolve any issues or conflicts

· Suggest and organize team building activities

· Manage the support expectations of our clients via phone, email, remote login and/or on-site as necessary via pro-active and reactive visits

· Ensure the team follows established procedures for routine work like creating new users, configuring laptops, and setting up workstations

· Ensure the prompt and thorough documentation of all work by the team via our ticketing system

· Ensure the consistency of our documentation efforts. Assist the team with documenting assets, configurations, passwords, processes, etc. and maintaining current and accurate documentation.

**Requirements (Must Have):**

· Incredible sense of pride and passion for what you do and a desire to help your teammates

· Minimum 3 years experience working for a Managed Service Provider (MSP) or in IT roles demonstrating excellent customer service and support

· Demonstrable experience both managing and working as part of an MSP team

· Experience with creating and updating SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures)

· Experience with building and mentoring a team

· Experience with compiling service related data and reporting for review (SLA metrics and other KPI's)

**Nice to Have:**

· Experience managing an issue or ticket tracking system and RMM tools

· Strong communication (written & verbal) and customer service skills

· Ability to learn new technologies and systems quickly)

· Ability to work through issues methodically)

· Ability & willingness to properly document processes and assets

· Expert level end-user and desktop support skills

· Experience and knowledge of Office 365 management

· Experience and knowledge of popular business cloud-based services

· Experience in virus and malware remediation

· Experience and knowledge of Active Directory & Azure AD administration

· Experience with policy management (Group Policy & Intune)

· Intermediate level server and networking skills· Experience using PowerShell & scripting

· Familiarity and understanding of ITIL Best Practices

**Benefits:**

· Competitive salary

· Paid time off

· Medical insurance

· Dental and vision insurance

· 401k plan

· FSA account options

· Long term disability insurance

· Commuter benefit plans

Benefit Conditions:

· Waiting period may apply

· Only full-time employees eligible

title: HR Associate
description:
Oakland Spine and Physical Therapy is an expanding, high energy, multi-discipline rehabilitation facility, with locations in Oakland, Wayne, Fair Lawn, Closter and Clifton, NJ, looking for an outstanding person to join our team!

We are looking to employ an HR Associate with outstanding administrative and communication skills. An HR Associate is expected to be a conceptual thinker with excellent organizational and time management skills. You must be reliable and should accurately follow instructions with the ability to multitask and acclimatize in a fast-paced environment.

The ideal candidate should display remarkable conflict management and decision-making skills with a solid understanding of employee relationships, staffing management, and payroll and benefits administration. Top candidates will be superb at problem-solving, efficient in scheduling and precise in the recruitment process.

HR Responsibilities may include:

* Support all internal and external HR related inquiries or requests.
* Maintain digital and electronic records of employees.
* Serve as point of contact with benefit vendors and administrators.
* Assist with the recruitment process by identifying candidates, holding interviews, and issuing employment contracts.
* Maintain calendars of the HR management team.
* Oversee the completion of compensation and benefit documentation.
* Assist with performance management procedures.
* Schedule meetings, interviews, HR events and maintain agendas.
* Coordinate training sessions and seminars.
* Perform orientations and update records of new staff.
* Produce and submit reports on general HR activity.
* Process payroll and resolve any payroll errors.
* Complete termination paperwork and exit interviews.
* Keep up-to-date with the latest HR trends and best practices.

HR Assistant Requirements:

* Bachelors degree in Human Resources a plus.
* 2+ years of experience in an HR setting
* Exposure to Labor Law and employment equity regulations a plus
* Effective HR administration and people management skills.
* Exposure to payroll practices.
* Full understanding of HR functions and best practices.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Works well under pressure and meets tight deadlines.
* Highly computer literate with capability in email, MS Office and related business and communication tools.
* Fantastic organizational and time management skills.
* Strong decision-making and problem-solving skills.
* Meticulous attention to detail.
* Ability to accurately follow instructions.

**Along with your resume submission, please include a cover letter stating why you feel you will be a great addition to our team. Also include your email address and best contact phone number.**
