**Minimum Degree Required:**
----------------------------


Bachelor's Degree

**Required Field(s) of Study**
------------------------------


Accounting, Business Administration/Management, Economics, Finance, International Business

**Minimum Year(s) of Experience**
---------------------------------


4 year(s)

**Certification(s) Required**
-----------------------------


CPA, Member of the Bar, EA, Ph.D. - Economics or Finance, Chartered Financial Analyst, Masters - Economics/Finance, Taxation, International Business, International Affairs or Public Administration, Public Policy, Arts & Science with emphasis on International Politics & Business, MBA

Master's Degree

**Preferred Fields of Study**
-----------------------------

**Preferred Knowledge/Skills**
------------------------------

* Demonstrates thorough knowledge of the economic analyses and resolution of complex global tax and finance issues faced by multinational corporations; including restructuring, divestitures, valuations and intercompany transactions.
* Demonstrates considerable knowledge of managing functional analyses interviews to identify and assess clients' cross-border intercompany transactions.
* Demonstrates considerable knowledge of performing market studies and industry research.
* Demonstrates comprehensive technical skills, including pricing policies, executing market studies and strategizing on local-country tax authority transfer pricing audits and advanced rulings.
* Demonstrates considerable experience identifying and addressing client needs: building, maintaining, and utilizing networks of client relationships and community involvement; communicating value propositions; managing resource requirements, project workflow, budgets, billing and collections; and, preparing and/or coordinating complex written and verbal materials.
* Demonstrates considerable experience as a team leader: supervising teams to create an atmosphere of trust; seeking diverse views to encourage improvement and innovation; and, coaching staff including providing timely meaningful written and verbal feedback.
* Demonstrates success as tax technical business advisor, including developing new relationships, making introductions to sell new services and doing so with a "One Firm" service mindset. Preferred familiarity with a CRM system.
* Demonstrates knowledge of automation & digitization in a professional services environment including but not limited to:
* Innovating through new and existing technologies, along with experimenting with digitization solutions;
* Working with large, complex data sets to build models and leverage data visualization tools to provide insights to clients; and,
* Utilizing digitization tools to reduce hours and optimize engagements Demonstrates knowledge of alternative fee arrangements, including the use of pricing tools, to provide a point of view on pricing strategies.

title: RBT (Registered Behavior Technician)
description:
**Job description**

About Gold Heart ABA:

Gold HeartABA is a leading provider of applied behaviour analysis (ABA) therapy, committed to making a positive impact on the lives of individuals with autism. We are seeking dedicated and compassionate ABA Therapists (RBTs) to join our team. In this role, you will work under the supervision of a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to use prompting and positive reinforcement to help individuals with autism develop essential skills for independence.

Key Responsibilities

* Provide applied behavior analysis (ABA) interventions to clients in natural environments.
* Collect, analyze, and prepare data for presentation.
* Coordinate with other program staff to ensure program consistency.
* Provide feedback to parents and guardians regarding the daily activities of clients.

Requirements

* Must be at least 18 years of age.
* High school diploma or equivalent required; Bachelor's degree in psychology, education, or related field is a plus.
* Previous experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities or behavioral disorders is a plus.
* Knowledge of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) principles and techniques is a Must.
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Ability to work effectively as part of a team.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and professionalism.
* Must be able to pass a criminal background check.
* Must have reliable transportation to travel to clients' homes or other clinic locations, based on client caseload.

Benefits

* Competitive salary:
* Flexible schedule.
* Paid time off.
* Professional development assistance.

Why Join Us?

At Gold Heart ABA, we offer competitive compensation packages, opportunities for advancement, and a supportive work environment. If you are passionate about helping individuals with special needs and are looking for a rewarding career, we encourage you to apply to join our team as a Behavior Technician.

Application Process

If you are passionate about making a difference in the lives of individuals with autism and have the necessary skills and experience, we encourage you to apply for this position. Join our team and help us create positive change in the lives of our clients and their families.

MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE AS AN RBT

title: Creator Brand Marketing Lead, Facebook
description:
The Creator Marketing team at Meta seeks an experienced individual to lead a team of brand managers that set the vision and build brand strategies that grow brand equity and relevance.In this role, you will lead a team that is at the helm of steering Facebook’s global brand, strategically embedding the brand in creator culture, ensuring creative excellence and consistency in visual identity, brand messaging and communications across all touch-points. You will partner with various teams to build foundations that streamline our go-to-market, providing strategic guidance for effective communications. Our ideal candidate will bring a blend of strategic brand marketing prowess and exceptional operational rigor, with a proven ability to work with stakeholders across marketing functions, including product marketing, product growth, research & insights, data science, comms & partnerships teams.  

  

  

### **Creator Brand Marketing Lead, Facebook Responsibilities:**

* Lead the Facebook Creator Brand Marketing team driving brand building aimed at growing and engaging Facebook's large community of creators.
* Develop our Facebook Creator brand strategy and planning including segmentation, targeting, market sizing, integrated communication plans, growing the brand's equity and driving business growth.
* Develop, manage, and grow a team of brand managers for Facebook Creators.
* Work with cross-functional counterparts across partnerships, comms, research & insights, product marketing and data science to align strategy with activations, messaging and measurement.
* Develop brand governance models, toolkits and guides to enable cross functional partners and streamline go-to-market.

  

  

  

### **Minimum Qualifications:**

* 8+ years experience in marketing/brand building at a tech, media or entertainment company.
* 4+ years of people leadership experience, including managing multiple levels of individual contributors.
* Experience leading global brand and communication strategies for international consumer brands.
* Experience applying analytical rigor, understanding of country-level market dynamics, and a mix of market and brand knowledge to deliver effective brand strategies for measurable ROI to the business.
* Experience connecting business and brand strategy, and extracting insights that translate into briefs that spark creativity.
* Experience navigating ambiguity, building initiatives from the ground up, demonstrating resourcefulness and influencing cross functional teams to rally behind a shared vision.
* Experience utilizing research and data to drive actionable insights to inform marketing strategy and improve the consumer experience.

  

  

  

### **Preferred Qualifications:**

* 12+ years experience in marketing/brand building at a tech, media or entertainment company.
* 7+ years of people leadership experience, including experience managing other people managers.
* Experience working in a fast paced, scrappy environment, thriving amidst ambiguity while ensuring executional excellence.
* In depth knowledge of creator culture and a history of spearheading successful creator initiatives.
* Experience supporting or working with a large partnerships or sales organization in an enablement capacity.

  

  

  

### **About Meta:**


Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.  

  

  

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.
  

  

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.  

  

$180,000/year to $252,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits  

  

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

title: Research Scientist Intern, AI Systems Machine Learning (PhD)
description:
Meta was built to help people connect and share, and over the last decade our tools have played a critical part in changing how people around the world communicate with one another. With over a billion people using the service and more than fifty offices around the globe, a career at Meta offers countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization.Meta is seeking Research Interns to join Fundamental AI Research (FAIR). We are committed to advancing the field of artificial intelligence by making fundamental advances in technologies to help interact with and understand our world. We are seeking individuals passionate in solving systems challenges in areas such as deep learning, computer vision, audio and speech processing, natural language processing, machine learning. Our interns have an opportunity to make core algorithmic advances and apply their ideas at an unprecedented scale.The mission of Meta FAIR's SysML research is to advance the state of AI through open science innovations. We explore, design, and build AI systems and infrastructures at scale to enable cutting-edge AI technologies.Our internships are twelve (12) to sixteen (16), or twenty-four (24) weeks long and we have various start dates throughout the year.  

  

  

### **Research Scientist Intern, AI Systems Machine Learning (PhD) Responsibilities:**

* Perform state of the art research to advance the science and technology of machine learning systems.
* Perform research that enables learning the semantics of data (images, video, text, audio, and other modalities).
* Devise better data-driven models of AI system design and optimization.
* Contribute research that leads to innovations in: scalable machine learning systems, resource-efficient AI data and algorithm scaling and neural network architectures, memory and energy-efficient AI systems, environmentally-sustainable AI system and hardware designs.
* Collaborate with researchers and cross-functional partners including communicating research plans, progress, and results.
* Publish research results and contribute to research that impacts Meta product development.

  

  

  

### **Minimum Qualifications:**

* Currently has or is in the process of obtaining a Ph.D. degree in Machine Learning, Systems, Artificial Intelligence, or relevant technical field.
* Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.
* Research experience in systems, computer architectures, compiler and programming languages, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.
* Experience with Python, C++, C, Lua or other related languages and with PyTorch framework.

  

  

  

### **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Intent to return to the degree program after the completion of the internship/co-op.
* Proven track record of achieving significant results as demonstrated by grants, fellowships, patents, as well as first-authored publications at leading workshops or conferences such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, MLSys, ISCA, ASPLOS, CGO, PLDI, PACT, HPCA, MICRO, or similar.
* Experience developing and optimizing systems for at-scale machine learning execution.
* Experience in real-system implementations.
* Experience devising data-driven models and real-system experiments and design implementation for AI system optimization.
* Experience with large machine learning model training and inference acceleration for distributed systems.
* Experience with scalable machine learning systems, resource-efficient AI data and algorithm scaling, or neural network architectures.
* Experience with memory and energy-efficient AI systems, environmentally-sustainable AI system designs, or AI-driven system optimization.
* Experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.
* Ability to manipulate and analyze complex, large scale, high-dimensionality data from varying sources.
* Experience in utilizing theoretical and empirical research to solve problems.
* Experience building systems based on machine learning and/or deep learning methods.
* Demonstrated software engineer experience via an internship, work experience, coding competitions, or widely used contributions in open source repositories (e.g. GitHub).
* Experience working and communicating cross functionally in a team environment.

  

  

  

### **About Meta:**


Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.  

  

  

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.
  

  

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.  

  

$7,500/month to $11,333/month + benefits

title: Chelsea Farmers Market Manager
description:
APPLY NOW  

Posted 9/9/24  




Part-time, $19/hour position available at our seasonal Chelsea Farmers Market in Manhattan. Work hours are weekly on Saturdays from 7am-3pm at the market, located near the corner of West 23rd St and Manhattan Avenues, and a few additional hours at home to file reports and occasionally in the field to help with promotion (generally a total of 8-10 hours weekly).


This is an ideal position for someone with retail, management, customer service, teaching, or other leadership experience, who is interested in learning about and contributing to the local food system. You should be friendly and happy to talk to all kinds of people, willing to do some physical work, able to communicate clearly and with confidence to both your Down to Earth colleagues and the vendors and customers in the market, organized and aware of the importance of good record keeping and reporting.


The Farmers Market Manager oversees day-of-market operations as Down to Earth Markets' on-site representative, working closely with the company's office team to help ensure the market's success and spearhead interactions with market vendors, shoppers and the community:


* Supervising and managing daily operations to assure a smooth- and safe-running market
* Enforcing market rules and regulations
* Proactively and consistently communicating with the office team
* Collaborating closely with the market's co-manager
* Collecting and reporting market data and success metrics
* Setting up and breaking down the market manager tent and display, market signage, and any other Down to Earth equipment as needed
* Posting to Facebook/Instagram on behalf of the market on market days and work with the Digital Marketing Manager to provide information and images from the market for marketing purposes
* Selling farmers market branded items
* Taking initiative in providing customer service; serving as a market host to welcome and engage shoppers, promoting good relations between vendors, our company, and the shoppers
* Assisting shoppers and vendors with use of food access and nutrition programs (SNAP, FMNP)
* Reporting successes, concerns and opportunities to Down to Earth Markets; sharing feedback and ideas
* Occasionally representing the farmers market at community events and through flyer distributions
* Attending weekly conference calls with fellow managers and the Operations Manager

Occasionally filling in for fellow site managers at other market locations  
* 

Physical / schedule requirements:


* Commit to consistently working 8-10 hours a week
* Able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds
* Able to walk and stand for several hours at a time
* Able to work in all weather conditions, e.g. heat, cold, rain, sun, wind, snow
* Lead market set up and breakdown, including directing people and vehicles, moving equipment, and cleaning up the market site as needed
* Complete two days of shadowing alongside another site manager at another farmers market as part of training
* Complete remote training, using a computer or smartphone, outside of market hours
* Complete the required flyer distribution blitz outside of market hours
* Communicate regularly, effectively, and in detail, including filing timely reports, to ensure a steady flow of information between the market and the office
* Monitor and reply to messages from the office, especially around end-of market reporting and pre-market prep
* Have use of a smartphone to use Microsoft Teams, our reporting web app, and Facebook/Instagram/Meta Business Suite during the market day

We are seeking candidates who are available to start immediately. Training will be provided.  

APPLY NOW


-

title: Scarsdale Farmers Market Manager
description:
APPLY NOW  

Posted 9/9/24  




Part-time, $20/hour position available at our brand new farmers market in Scarsdale. Work hours are weekly on Sundays from 7am-3pm at the market, located at the intersection of Spencer Road and Chase Place, and a few additional hours at home to file reports and occasionally in the field to help with promotion (generally a total of 8-10 hours weekly).


This is an ideal position for someone with retail, management, customer service, teaching, or other leadership experience, who is interested in learning about and contributing to the local food system. You should be friendly and happy to talk to all kinds of people, willing to do some physical work, able to communicate clearly and with confidence to both your Down to Earth colleagues and the vendors and customers in the market, organized and aware of the importance of good record keeping and reporting.


The Farmers Market Manager oversees day-of-market operations as Down to Earth Markets' on-site representative, working closely with the company's office team to help ensure the market's success and spearhead interactions with market vendors, shoppers and the community:


* Supervising and managing daily operations to assure a smooth- and safe-running market
* Enforcing market rules and regulations
* Proactively and consistently communicating with the office team
* Collaborating closely with the market's co-manager
* Collecting and reporting market data and success metrics
* Setting up and breaking down the market manager tent and display, market signage, and any other Down to Earth equipment as needed
* Posting to Facebook/Instagram on behalf of the market on market days and work with the Digital Marketing Manager to provide information and images from the market for marketing purposes
* Selling farmers market branded items
* Taking initiative in providing customer service; serving as a market host to welcome and engage shoppers, promoting good relations between vendors, our company, and the shoppers
* Assisting shoppers and vendors with use of food access and nutrition programs (SNAP, FMNP)
* Reporting successes, concerns and opportunities to Down to Earth Markets; sharing feedback and ideas
* Occasionally representing the farmers market at community events and through flyer distributions
* Attending weekly conference calls with fellow managers and the Operations Manager

Occasionally filling in for fellow site managers at other market locations  
* 

Physical / schedule requirements:


* Commit to consistently working 8-10 hours a week
* Able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds
* Able to walk and stand for several hours at a time
* Able to work in all weather conditions, e.g. heat, cold, rain, sun, wind, snow
* Lead market set up and breakdown, including directing people and vehicles, moving equipment, and cleaning up the market site as needed
* Complete two days of shadowing alongside another site manager at another farmers market as part of training
* Complete remote training, using a computer or smartphone, outside of market hours
* Complete the required flyer distribution blitz outside of market hours
* Communicate regularly, effectively, and in detail, including filing timely reports, to ensure a steady flow of information between the market and the office
* Monitor and reply to messages from the office, especially around end-of market reporting and pre-market prep
* Have use of a smartphone to use Microsoft Teams, our reporting web app, and Facebook/Instagram/Meta Business Suite during the market day

We are seeking candidates who are available to start immediately. Training will be provided.  

APPLY NOW


-

title: Lead Package Attendant
description:
A Lead Package Attendant is a responsible, dependable and professional individual who is able to successfully ensure the maintenance and organization of the package room, located at one of our luxury residential clients. This role requires strong leadership skills, excellent communication abilities, and a commitment to providing exceptional service. *There are both Full Time and Part Time positions available.*

 **ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Supervise and lead a team of package attendants to ensure timely and accurate processing of incoming and outgoing packages.
* Assign tasks and responsibilities to team members, monitor performance, and provide coaching and feedback as needed.
* Logs and book incoming packages into the accurate Smart Package Rooms.
* Organize outgoing packages and assign packages to appropriate carriers.
* Provide superior customer service to all residents and guests, and facilitate and address client phone calls & emails.
* Help provide a safe, healthy and clean environment for all members, guests and employees.
* Connect clients with appropriate vendors, including but not limited to, handymen, pet care providers, maid services, and dry cleaners.
* Handle the sales of all moving and shipping supplies and assist with the rental of moving equipment.
* Provide additional business services including but not limited to, making photocopies, sending faxes, scanning documents.
* Assist clients with any of their shipping inquiries
* Assist clients with troubleshooting and locating misplaced or missing packages.
* Assist clients with trouble shooting their software or computer errors.
* Perform any cleaning and sanitizing duties as assigned to help establish and maintain showroom quality at all times, as well as to ensure a safe living environment.
* Inspect the package room and report any unsafe conditions or faulty equipment to the Manager.
* Adhere and adapt to all new LIVunLtd policies, procedures and initiatives.
* Wear corporate / building approved uniforms for each specific LIVunLtd location where you are working.
* Perform additional duties and responsibilities specific to the location / building and upon the request of your manager.

 **SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS**.


* Must have the ability to communicate clearly and effectively with residents and other coworkers.
* Must be able to work independently.
* Must be able to lift up to 50lbs.
* Must possess a friendly attitude, have excellent customer service skills, and a commitment to executing all duties in a professional manner.
* Must be familiar with Microsoft Office applications and able to pick up new technologies
* Have a High School Diploma or equivalent
* Ability to work on Saturdays.

 **NOTE**



The specific examples in each section are not intended to be all-inclusive, they represent the typical elements and criteria considered necessary to perform. Other job-related duties may be assigned and could require work outside of duties listed. This description is subject to change, at the sole discretion of the Company, and in no way creates an employment contract, implied or otherwise; “at will” employment remains.

 **COMPENSATION**


The Lead Package Attendant positions with LIVunLtd offers $20 per hour and differs based upon work experience and location.

title: CL A Tanker & Hazmat Paid 300/Day Salary Run 21-Home 6-8 Days-86-105K
description:
We're actively seeking dedicated Class A drivers to join our team, running dedicated regional routes with a fantastic starting pay of $300/Day for all drivers. Your earnings will increase up to $324/Day, with a $3/Day pay raise every 6 months. Drivers must hold Hazmat and Tanker endorsements, along with a minimum of 1-year verifiable Class A driving experience (preferably Tanker OTR, but no OTR experience or Tanker? No worries – we provide training).


**Key Highlights:**



* Dedicated regional runs to one client, based on customer needs, covering various regional areas in the continental US. Regions include FL, NV to NM, TX, St Louis, and more.
* Company pays for your flight home during home time if you are not within 200 miles to drive. If you choose to drive, ensure you have a secure parking location or park at your house.
* Trucks are not slip-seated; they are 100% assigned to drivers, and they are newer model Peterbilts.
* Flexible run/home time options: 21 days out with 5-7 days home or over 21 days out with a minimum of 7 days home.
* Running a cryogenic tanker with no cryogenic experience needed. Some tanker experience is required, and hazmat endorsement is a must.


Compensation and Benefits:



* $1500 sign-on bonus ($500 after orientation and $1000 after 30 days)
* First-year pay ranges from $86,000 to $106,000.
* Full training provided on cryogenic deliveries at $125/Day.
* Full benefits kick in after 60 days, including medical, vision, dental, PTO, 401K, and cell phone reimbursement.


Requirements:



* One-year verifiable Class A OTR or Regional driving experience in the last 3 years with at least some tanker experience.
* Must have Hazmat and Tanker endorsements; those with tanker or cryogenic experience will be expedited.
* Cannot be SAP – no failed or refused drug test ever.
* Relatively clean MVR
* No more than 5 jobs in the last 3 years, avoiding job hopping.

title: Construction Site Superintendent
description:
North Jersey Construction firm seeks a well organized Super in General Construction with the ability to push subcontractors while keeping the customer satisfied for public works projects located in New Jersey. Experience with public schools is a plus.

Following criteria's are a must:

* Proficiency in Microsoft Exchange and MS Office
* Ability to read technical/architectural drawings
* Strong analytical, organizational, communication, problem solving and decision making skills
* Provide owner progress reports with supporting documentation
* Assist in preparing monthly billing
* Oversee site specific health and safety programs
* Prepare project close outs
* Ability to multitask with attention to detail
* Technically inclined to understand and explain construction project scopes of work
* Proficient in Procore

Principles only. Recruiters. please do not contact this job post.

Interested candidates may send their resumes directly via email to Joseph Gonzalez at JGonzalez @ hsmechanical.com and Daniel Jr. Hernandez at DanJr @HSmechanical.com

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: CL A Regional Dedicated Home Wkly No Touch
description:
**Class A drivers run regionally in CT, NY and NJ getting home weekly earning $1500-$1700+/WK. All freight is no touch**


**Position Overview:**


* **Routes**: Drivers will run for client in NJ, CT, NY
* **Freight**: This freight is 100% no touch freight with hook n go pick ups in Amsterdam NY. Drivers will make deliveries to stores and all freight will be no touch
* **Home Time**: Drivers run 5-5.5 days and are home weekly. Drivers are NOT guaranteed being home weekends
* **Location: Drivers MUST live in NJ or NY and live within 250 miles of NYC**


**Compensation:**


* **Pay** Drivers with up to 6 months verifiable experience will start at $70CPM and drivers with 5+ years verifiable experience will start at $.75CPM
* **Earnings**: Average earnings are $1500-$1700+/WK – comes to $78-$83K
* **Orientation**: Company pays for travel, hotel and meals.

**Equipment:**


* **Trucks**: Trucks are newer model Freightliner Cascadias and are assigned to drivers no slip seating


**Benefits:**


* **Start**: Full benefits begin 60 days after starting
* **Includes**: Medical, dental, 401K, paid time off, and more.
* **Riders and Pets**: Riders and dogs are welcome


**Requirements:**


* **Age**: Must be at least 21 years old
* **Experience**:
+ Minimum 6 months of verifiable Class A Experience in the last 12 months or 12 months verifiable Class A Experience in the last 5 years
+ (PLEASE NOTE DRIVERS WITH ONLY ONE JOB AND EXCEPTIONAL WORK HISTORY AND BACKGROUND WITH 3 MONTHS CLASS A EXPERIENCE WILL BE CONSIDERED)

* **Driving Record**:
+ No more than 2 moving violations in the last 12 months (includes personal and CDL)
+ Can not have any serious traffic violations (in personal and CMV) in the last 12 months including 15+, Reckless, handheld, following too closely etc
+ 30+ is an auto DQ for 3 years
+ No more than 1 on road DOT Recordable Preventable accident in the last 2 years; however, cannot have any major preventable accidents in the last 5 years and this includes jack knife, overturn, etc.
+ No more than 3 preventable incidents in the last 2 years and combination of accidents and incidents cannot exceed 3
+ No more than 4 jobs in the last 12 months and cannot have been let go from most recent company for safety violations. Only one termination for safety allowed in the last 5 years (For trainees only requirement is cannot be unemployed for 12 months in the last 3 years)
+ No DUIs in the last ten years
+ Can never have failed or refused a DOT Drug test ever

* **Hiring Areas**: Drivers must live within 250 miles of NYC in the state of NY or NJ. Drivers can live anywhere in the boroughs or Long Island

title: CL A Drivers Run Home Every Other W/End 3 Days-100% No Touch Dry Van
description:
Looking for the best Class A drivers to run 11 days and be home every other weekend for 3 full days. Please read requirements below and if you do not meet ALL requirements, you will not be considered.


* Drivers run 11 days and then are home 3 full days every other weekend.


* This is 100% no touch with average fleet pay of $95K/ year – mileage pay is $.67-.$.71CPM based upon experience and if you have hazmat. Hazmat is not required. This comes to average weekly pay of $1850-$1900/WK


* This is 100% no touch dry van with newer model Freightliners and KW T680. All trucks come with flat screen TVs, 1500 watt inverters, microwaves, fridge and XM radio.
* Running area is IL, KY, IN, OH, PA, MD, WV, VA, CT, NC, DE, MA, CT, RI - there is no NY state and no NYC or Long Island.
* Great benefits and bonus program for clean inspections.
* Basically, if you are one of the top drivers you are treated as such and that is why we have one of the lowest turnover rates in the industry



Requirements – again – if you do not meet all requirements, you will not be considered.


Must have 9 months verifiable Class A OTR or Regional experience in the last 15 months with at least 2 months of winter driving



Clean MVR with no DOT Preventable accidents in the last 3 years


Absolutely no SAP drivers – can never have failed a DOT Drug or Alcohol test



No Major moving violations in the last 3 years. Includes both personal and CMV



No DOT Recordable accidents in the last 4 years and can not have more than one incident in the last 18 months



No more than 5 jobs in the last 3 years


No DUI in PMV (never in CMV) in the last 7 years and only one in a lifetime

title: CL A 100% No Touch Dry Van -90-100K/YR Home Every Other W/End
description:
Seeking top-tier Class A drivers for an exceptional opportunity! Enjoy an 11-day driving cycle with a full 3-day weekend off every other week. Please carefully review the requirements below, as only candidates meeting all criteria will be considered.


**Key Highlights:**



* 11 days on the road, followed by a relaxing 3-day weekend home every other week.
* 100% no-touch freight with an average fleet pay of $90-$100K/Yr.
* Mileage pay ranges from $.67 to $.71 CPM, contingent on experience and hazmat endorsement (not required).
* State-of-the-art equipment: newer model Freightliners and KW T680 with amenities like flat-screen TVs, 1500 watt inverters, microwaves, fridges, and XM radio.
* Operating exclusively in IL, KY, IN, OH, PA, MD, WV, VA, CT, NC, DE, MA, CT, RI - no routes through NY state, NYC, or Long Island.
* Great benefits and a bonus program for clean inspections.
* Recognizing and treating top-performing drivers with the utmost respect, resulting in one of the industry's lowest turnover rates.


**Requirements:**



* Minimum 9 months verifiable Class A OTR or Regional experience in the last 15 months with at least 2 months in winter weather conditions
* Clean MVR with no DOT preventable accidents in the last 3 years.
* No SAP drivers - must not have failed a DOT Drug or Alcohol test.
* No major moving violations in the last 3 years, encompassing both personal and CMV.
* No DOT recordable accidents in the last 4 years, with no more than one incident in the last 18 months.
* No more than 5 jobs held in the last 3 years.
* No DUI in a personal motor vehicle (PMV) in the last 7 years, and only one in a lifetime.


If you meet all these requirements and are ready to join a team that values and rewards excellence, apply now for an unparalleled driving experience!
